required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gingival Crevicular IL-34 and CSF-1 Levels in Patients With Periodontitis and Uncontrolled Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: Type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) is a metabolic disorder characterized by chronic hyperglycemia caused by defects in insulin secretion or insulin resistance. With the progressive deterioration of the beta cells with the addition of insulin resistance, this chronic metabolic disease occurs.(1) It has been shown that poor glycemic control predisposes to periodontal disease, and there is a bidirectional relationship between periodontal disease and DM.(2) The common pathogenic mechanism between diabetes and periodontal disease is due to increased production of various inflammatory mediators such as matrix metalloproteases, RANKL, prostaglandin E2, cytokines and chemokines.(3,4) Currently there is no data relationship between CSF-1 and IL-34, periodontal disease and diabetes.The aim of this study was three stage: First, to assess GCF levels of IL-34 and CSF-1 in stage III and grade C periodontitis (SIII-GC-P) patients with and without T2DM. Second, to compare these molecules levels in GCF with systemically-periodontally healthy (H) individuals. Third, to investigate the correlation between biochemical parameters and clinical parameters.

detailed_description.textblock:
Inclusion criteria for H groups consisted of individuals with clinically healthy gingiva on a stable periodontium who had a bleeding on probing (BOP) score of less than 10% and probing depth (PD) ≤ 3 mm and showed no clinical attachment loss (CAL) or radiographic bone loss. Individuals who did not have systemic disease with at least 20 permanent teeth were included in the study.
Inclusion criteria for SIII-GC-P patients were based on the new classification published in 2017.23,24,25 Individuals with an interdental CAL ≥ 5 mm, PPD ≥ 6 mm with radiographic bone destruction continuing to the middle or apical part of the root and a maximum loss of 4 teeth because of periodontitis were considered as group of SIII periodontitis (in 30% and more regions). During the diagnosis of periodontitis, care was taken that CAL did not originate from gingival recession of traumatic origin, tooth decay extending to the cervical of the tooth, CAL seen in the distal of the second molar associated with the extraction or malposition of the third molar, lesion in the marginal periodontium of endodontic origin, or vertical root fracture. Radiographic bone destruction was assessed from the tooth, which demonstrated the very serious bone destruction as a proportion of root length. If there is rapid bone loss compared to the biofilm and the % of root bone loss /age > 1.0; it was determined as GC periodontitis.
Inclusion criteria for T2DM patients were based on the American Diabetes association published in 2010. Individuals to the T2DM group; It was selected from individuals diagnosed with T2DM for more than 5 years by their own physicians according to daily plasma glucose (200 mg / dl) and hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c ≥6.5%).26 Plaque index (PI), gingival index (GI) and presence of bleeding on probing (BOP) were measured at four sites.27,28,29 Probing depth (PD) and attachment loss (AL) were used during the clinical periodontal assessment at six sites per tooth except the third molar. All periodontal assessments were conducted with a manual probe (Williams, Hu-Friedy, Chicago, IL) by an experienced calibrated periodontist (AD) masked to the groups. Tooth loss due to periodontitis was also evaluated with the participants' own reports.
AL and PD were measured in ten periodontitis patients who were not included in the study for a calibration exercise. Intra-examiner reliability of the parameters was achieved by obtaining intraclass correlation coefficients of 0.86 for PD and 0.84 for CAL.
Taking GCF samples GCF samples were collected in the morning hours 24-48 h after the clinical periodontal evaluation. GCF was obtained from the buccal part of the interdental area of single rooted teeth using paper strips (Periopaper; Proflow). In periodontal healthy control group, GCP was obtained from the regions without BOP and inflammation, whereas in the periodontitis group, GCF was accumulated from the regions where the most radiographic bone loss and PD were observed. After the existing plaque was removed with a sterile curette, the region was insulated with cotton rolls and air-dried, and then the paper strip was placed in the gingival sulcus and left for 30 s to absorb the fluid. Paper strips infected with oral fluids were not included in the study. The paper strips were moved to sterile tubes and maintained at -40°C until analyses.

primary_outcome.measure: to assess GCF levels of IL-34 and CSF-1 in stage III and grade C periodontitis (SIII-GC-P) patients with and without T2DM
primary_outcome.time_frame: GCF samples were collected in the morning hours 24-48 hours after clinical periodontal measurement. GCF was obtained using strips of filter paper† from the buccal part of an interproximal region.
primary_outcome.description: GCF was obtained using strips of filter paper† from the buccal part of an interproximal region.

secondary_outcome.measure: to compare these molecules levels in GCF with systemically-periodontally healthy (H) individuals.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: GCF samples were collected in the morning hours 24-48 hours after clinical periodontal measurement.
secondary_outcome.description: GCF was obtained using strips of filter paper† from the buccal part of an interproximal region.

arm_group.description: Consisted of individuals with clinically healthy gingiva on an intact periodontium who had a BOP score less than 10% and PD≤3mm, showed no attachment loss or radiographic bone loss.

Consisted of individuals with interdental AL ≥5 mm, radiographic bone lose extending to middle or apical third of the root, PD≥6 mm and tooth loss due to periodontitis of ≤4. Rapid bone loss is observed compared to biofilm and % Root Bone Loss/age >1.0 is determined as grade C.

Inclusion criteria for T2DM patients were based on the American Diabetes association published in 2010. Individuals to the T2DM group; It was selected from individuals diagnosed with T2DM for more than 5 years by their own physicians according to daily plasma glucose (200 mg / dl) and hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c ≥6.5%). Consisted of individuals with interdental AL ≥5 mm, radiographic bone lose extending to middle or apical third of the root, PD≥6 mm and tooth loss due to periodontitis of ≤4. Rapid bone loss is observed compared to biofilm and % Root Bone Loss/age >1.0 is determined as grade C.

intervention.description: GCF samples were collected in the morning hours 24-48 hours after clinical periodontal measurement.

study_pop.textblock: individuals who have periodontal disease with Tip 2 diabetes mellitus will be selected
